required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Selective Use of Antibiotics in Neonates Born to Mothers With Suspected Chorioamnionitis
clinical_study.official_title: Selective Use of Antibiotics in Neonates Born to Mothers With Suspected Chorioamnionitis

lead_sponsor.agency: Mednax Center for Research, Education, Quality and Safety

clinical_study.source: Mednax Center for Research, Education, Quality and Safety

brief_summary.textblock: Retrospective Chart Review to determine the selective use of antibiotics in neonates born to mothers with suspected chorioamnionitis

detailed_description.textblock: To determine the incidence and types of adverse outcomes in infants born to mothers with signs of chorioamnionitis when these infants are asymptomatic and are not treated with antibiotics empirically.

primary_outcome.measure: Infants born to mother with chorioamnionitis/intrapartum fever as assessed by chart review.
primary_outcome.time_frame: Infants born from July, 2012 to December 31, 2018.
primary_outcome.description: The retrospective chart review would analyze the total number of infants born to mothers with chorioamnionitis/intrapartum fever.

study_pop.textblock: Patients born at Women's Hospital/Cone Health in Greensboro, NC, from July, 2012 (when EMR was implemented), to present.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
â€¢ Mother/baby dyads in which the mother was diagnosed with chorioamnionitis and/or had intrapartum fever (as diagnosed by obstetrician)
Exclusion Criteria: None

eligibility.gender_description: Mother/baby in which the mother was diagnosed with chorioamnionitis and/or had intrapartum fever
